definition: to drift without a resting place (idiom)/roving/errant/vagrant/erratic

sentences.english: Occasionally someflamewould come pursuit of her errant swain.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾也有情人追來尋找她行蹤飄忽的情郎。

sentences.english: Why did she describe herself as feeling “adrift”?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼她描述自己感覺“飄忽不定”呢？

sentences.english: Thoughts may go exotic night souls, in the open on the Makino erratic.
sentences.chinese: 思緒似異域夜走的魂靈，在空曠的牧野上飄忽不定。

sentences.english: But the trees spun darkness for a wandering beam of sun.
sentences.chinese: 樹影間搖曳着一縷飄忽的陽光，黑暗因此支離。

sentences.english: Her alcoholic mother drift edinandout of her life.
sentences.chinese: 她酗酒的母親在黛登的生活中蕩進盪出，飄忽不定。

sentences.english: Gust of wind blowing, rain sway, the scene also seems to.
sentences.chinese: 陣風吹來，雨簾晃動，雨中之景好像也在飄忽不定。

sentences.english: I see the moon wiggling in the stream.
sentences.chinese: 明月在流水裏飄忽彷徨。

sentences.english: Occasionally some flame would come in pursuit of her errant swain.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾也有情人追來尋找她行蹤飄忽的情郎。

sentences.english: Once the storm is over, eagle rock sounds cheerful again uncertain in Murakami.
sentences.chinese: 雨過天晴，巖鷹歡快的叫聲重又在村上飄忽。

sentences.english: Listening to it, often feels erratic cloud came between.
sentences.chinese: 聽着它，往往感覺來到了飄忽不定的雲間。

sentences.english: I would miss my loving, erratic, harebrained mother.
sentences.chinese: 想念我親愛的飄忽不定，粗心大意的媽媽。

sentences.english: Its nature is like opaline doves'-neck luster, hovering and evanescent.
sentences.chinese: 美的本質猶如鴿子頸項上的乳白光澤，飄忽即逝。

sentences.english: Boys and girls like it when the soul of a daze, erratic, to come and go without a trace.
sentences.chinese: 它就像少男少女發呆時的靈魂，飄忽不定，來去無蹤。

definition: to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
déjà vu (the experience of seeing exactly the same situation a second time)/seemingly familiar/apparently already acquainted
to drift without a resting place (idiom)/roving/errant/vagrant/erratic
lit. seeming neither close nor distant (idiom)/fig. to keep one's distance/(of a relationship) lukewarm/vague
